file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 26-14-01-02 - SMOKE DETECTOR SENSOR - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SMOKE DETECTOR SENSOR - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to discard the lavatory smoke detector. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY LAVATORY SMOKE DETECTOR - RE- ALL 26-14-01-960-801-A ♦ PLACEMENT EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 26-14-01 Page 1 of 3 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-14-01-960-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. LAVATORY SMOKE DETECTOR - REPLACEMENT A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to replace the lavatory smoke detector. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 26-14-01-000-801-A/400 LAVATORY SMOKE DETECTOR - REMOVAL AMM TASK 26-14-01-400-801-A/400 LAVATORY SMOKE DETECTOR - INSTALLATION NOHMI CMM ATA 26-19-03 - NOHMI CMM ATA 26-19-04 - SIEMENS CMM ATA 26-11-18 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 263 263ALC Passenger Cabin/Lavatory D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Lavatory I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A WARNING: MAKE SURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT IS IN A SAFE CONDITION BEFORE YOU DO THE MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. THIS IS TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the LAVATORY SMOKE DET circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 960-801-A/200 26-14-01 Page 2 of 3 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Lavatory Smoke Detector - Replacement SUBTASK 960-003-A WARNING: • DO NOT DISASSEMBLE THE SMOKE DETECTOR SENSOR. THE SMOKE DETECTOR IS OF THE IONIZATION TYPE AND CONTAINS A RADIOACTIVE SUBSTANCE SEALED IN THE SENSOR. IF YOU DISASSEMBLE THE SMOKE DETECTOR SENSOR, THE RADIOACTIVE SUBSTANCE IN IT CAN CAUSE SERIOUS INJURIES TO YOU. • TO DISCARD THE SMOKE DETECTOR SENSOR, YOU MUST OBEY THE REGULATIONS FOR THE USE OF RADIOACTIVE MATERIALS APPLICABLE TO YOUR COUNTRY OR SEND THE SMOKE DETECTOR SENSOR BACK TO THE MANUFACTURER. RADIOACTIVE MATERIALS ARE VERY DANGEROUS AND CAN CAUSE SERIOUS INJURIES TO PERSONS. (1) Remove the lavatory smoke detector ( AMM TASK 26-14-01-000-801-A/400). (2) Discard the smoke detector system. Refer to the last revision of NOHMI CMM ATA 26-19-03 and NOHMI CMM ATA 26-19-04 or refer to the last revision of SIEMENS CMM ATA 26-11-18, according to the configuration of your smoke detector. (3) Install a serviceable lavatory smoke detector ( AMM TASK 26-14-01-400-801-A/400). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the LAVATORY SMOKE DET circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 960-801-A/200 26-14-01 Page 3 of 3 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
